basic_level.question: Which organism causes tuberculosis?
basic_level.explanation: Mycobacterium tuberculosis is the primary causative agent of tuberculosis in humans. It is an acid-fast bacillus characterized by its unique cell wall structure containing mycolic acids.

basic_level.question: Which of the following is the characteristic histological feature of tuberculosis?
basic_level.explanation: Caseating granulomas are the hallmark histological feature of tuberculosis. They consist of epithelioid histiocytes, multinucleated giant cells (Langhans giant cells), and central caseous necrosis.
